summary: The Catalyzing Housing and American Ready Growth and Expansion Investments Act (CHARGE Investments Act) amends Title 49 of the United States Code to expand eligibility for transit-oriented development projects under the railroad rehabilitation program. It allows for direct loans and loan guarantees for projects near fixed guideway transit and intercity passenger rail stations. The bill defines project eligibility based on proximity to transit stations and downtown cores, mandating the inclusion of private investment.
